name: Reference Pointer
description: This data type transmits information about data stored on another system.  It contains a reference pointer that uniquely identifies the data on the other system, the identity of the other system, and the type of data.

fields.name: Pointer
fields.description: A unique key assigned by the system that stores the data.  The key, which is an ST data type, is used to identify and access the data

fields.name: Application ID
fields.description: A unique designator of the system that stores the data.  It is an HD data type (See Section 2.8.18, “HD - hierarchic designator”).  It is equivalent to the application ID of the placer or filler order number (see Chapter 4).  Application ID’s must be unique across a given HL7 implementation

fields.name: Type Of Data
fields.description: An ID data type that declares the general type of data.  Refer to HL7 table 0191- Type of referenced data for valid values

fields.name: Subtype
fields.description:
An ID data type declaring the format for the data of subcomponent <main type>.  Refer to HL7 table 0291 - Subtype of referenced data for valid values.

Possible subtypes are specific to main types (though in principle the same subtype could be used for more than one main type), and so are defined under their main types.
- Image subtypes 
- Audio subtypes
- Application subtypes
